     everyone wants to save the world but no one is quite sure how

8.4.17  3:31 pm   what type of music chords are you using in your "history of ____" videos?

     i just use whatever configurations of notes i need for each situation

     they sound like complex major 7th chords or chord stack on top of each other. and what intervals do you move them in?

     whichever ones necessary. all the intervals are part of my repertoire

      the chords sound out of key with each other but they still all work so well together. 

     i'm just trying to be reasonable

     to have some variety, while still keeping that sweet brand recognition

     answer 21,000 questions

8.4.17  12:47 pm   Okay you should automate all "this or that" and "this or that?" questions next. Or let one of your programmer fans do it for you

     it already is. i am adding items to the list over time. but i don't think 'this' or 'that' will be added, because when it is said that way it's not really the same

8.4.17  12:41 pm   Is there a deeper meaning to any of your videos?

     the meaning in everything i do is "hey check out this thing i made" which i think is pretty deep because making stuff is a very powerful thing to do

8.4.17  11:59 am   hi bill nice to meet you I'm sure this has been asked before but I cba to scroll down to find it there are millions of questions but anyway, how did you filter out information of the history of the entire world video, it seems you are very familiar with world history and knows so much about what happens in all parts of the world I am so impressed and admire you so much for doing that video. 

     it took a very long time to do all the things you mentioned. although many people assume it happened instantly

8.4.17  11:58 am   What is "i wanna be a movie star" supposed to be about?

     feelings, hopes and dreams, and the human experience in general

8.4.17  11:53 am   Why doesn't this website have a tab icon?

     because i didn't want to make one

      Can I ask multiple questions?

     sure

      Can you still answer my questions even if I am not supposed to ask multiple questions?

     sure

      Can you just pretend like I only asked the first question?

     it is too late now

8.4.17  11:49 am   Are you actually answering these questions or is it your unpaid intern? 

     it would be nice to teach someone else how to do it, but it is still me. i should also point out what when you ask if it's "you" (me) the answer would be yes regardless of who this is. everyone is themself

     i would ask them to stop

8.4.17  10:34 am   why should I care about life in general?

8.4.17  10:26 am   in i wanna be a movie star is the chorus like 16/16 or whatever and then the verse 9/8 or am i just really bad at figuring out time signatures?

     the chorus has 9 beats in the cycle. you can break it up however you choose, but i chose to hear it as alternating 4/4 + 5/4. the verses are initially based on that pattern but break it also.

      speaking of, what is the difference between 4/4 8/8 16/16 2/2 or anything else like that

     those are all mathematically the same (like the bars will look the same on paper) but usually the second number says what kind of note gets the beat. so like, in 4/4, the quarter note is where the beat is. in 2/2 (also nicknamed "cut time") the bars look exactly the same, but the half note gets the beat (you tap your foot on the half note intead of the quarter note.) the main difference would really be the tempo -- cut time (2/2) is designed for the bars to basically go twice as fast. and when you see a tempo marking on the top of the page, it will say "half note = xxx b.p.m" instead of "quarter note = xxx b.p.m". so in cut time (2/2) the bars will usually go by twice as fast. what the point of this is exactly, i'm not sure. i think cut time was used much more 100 years ago. perhaps people were too lazy to write 16th notes and preferred to use 8th notes for the fast stuff instead. i'm not sure. 8/8 and 16/16 are really never used. time signatures ending in 8 also don't necessarily follow this rule of what note gets the beat, for example sometimes 7/8 is used when in reality the quarter note should get the beat, and the actual time signature would be "3 and a half/4" but no one says that for insanity reasons. also 6/8 is very very commonly counted as the dotted quarter note getting the beat, in which case the actual time signature would technically be "2/2.66666" which again would be completely insane to see written on the page

8.4.17  10:09 am   9.26.15  7:14 pm   What's your favorite planet

      i've only been on one. this one is really great, but to critique it, there's too many oceans, so you can't even get to everywhere without paying for a plane.

Is that where you got the "I can't get anywhere without buying a boat" from?

     if you are asking if i got the line from myself the answer is yes

LEMME LIVE MY DREAM." is this true or don't you love dogs?
